response.answer_text: I’m no doctor and have no real idea what George Washington died of. The symptoms SOUND like pneumonia. Suppose that’s it. Washington was a big, strong man. If he had pneumonia, and had just lain in bed sipping hot tea, there’s at least a chance he’d have recovered on his own. Doctors in those days tended to make things worse rather than better.

There was a doctor with a new medical treatment that would have saved Washington. Instead George went with the traditional treatment that killed him. Most doctors were quacks back then, and their patients survived only in spite of the medical treatment, not because of it. The body has some self healing properties that work even when quacks are trying to kill the patient.
